message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) which is a subfield of Natural Language Processing (NLP). The paper also mentions the use of a language model which is a common technique in NLP. 

It could also belong to cs.SD (Sound) as it deals with speech recognition and processing. 

cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another likely sub-category as the paper mentions the use of deep learning techniques such as Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs). 

cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a possible sub-category as ASR is a common application of AI. 

Finally, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is a less likely sub-category as the paper mentions the use of CNNs which are commonly used in computer vision, but the focus of the paper is on speech recognition rather than image processing.
